getPassName - Return a nice clean name for a pass.

This usually implemented in terms of the name that is registered by one of the Registration templates, but can be overloaded directly.

### PrintAsmMemoryOperand() {#aea0222019864e26fb2597569c0e1ff02}

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Print the specified operand of MI, an INLINEASM instruction, using the specified assembler variant as an address.

Targets should override this to format as appropriate. This method can return true if the operand is erroneous.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/veasmprinter-cpp/#l00063">63</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/veasmprinter-cpp">VEAsmPrinter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### PrintAsmOperand() {#a04010d9ed865881dd7b2efc51319d44d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool VEAsmPrinter::PrintAsmOperand (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42; MI, unsigned OpNo, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; ExtraCode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; O)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Print the specified operand of MI, an INLINEASM instruction, using the specified assembler variant.

PrintAsmOperand - Print the specified operand of MI, an INLINEASM instruction, using the specified assembler variant.

Targets should override this to format as appropriate. This method can return true if the operand is erroneous.

Targets should override this to format as appropriate for machine specific ExtraCodes or when the arch-independent handling would be too complex otherwise.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/veasmprinter-cpp/#l00061">61</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/veasmprinter-cpp">VEAsmPrinter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
